meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the writings of the early Christian fathers.
meanings.sent1: The patristical teachings of the early Christian fathers are still studied today.
meanings.sent2: Her essay had a patristical tone, reminiscent of the early Christian fathers' writings.
meanings.sent3: The patristical arguments in the debate made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a patristical masterpiece, weaving together the wisdom of the early Christian fathers.
meanings.sent5: The patristical influence on the church's doctrine was profound and lasting.

meanings.definition: In the style or manner of the early Christian fathers.
meanings.sent1: The choir's music had a patristical quality, echoing the melodies of the early Christian fathers.
meanings.sent2: The artwork in the cathedral was designed in a patristical fashion, honoring the early Christian fathers.
meanings.sent3: The patristical attire worn by the actors in the play added a unique touch.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was a patristical tribute to the early Christian fathers' legacy.
meanings.sent5: The patristical architecture of the church reflected the influence of the early Christian fathers.
